All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
AddAppointmentController
Controller for the Add Appointment view, enabling users to input and submit new appointments.
AddCustomerController
Controller for the Add Customer view, providing functionality to input and submit new customer records.
Alerts
This class simplifies the process of alert generation.
AppContext
This class provides a global context for the application, holding information about the current user's locale, time zone, and login information.
AppEntryPoint
This class serves as the main entry point for the JavaFX application.
Appointment
Represents an appointment, including details such as title, type, start and end times, and associated customer and user IDs.
AppointmentsQuery
Provides static methods for performing CRUD operations on the appointments table in the database.
ApptMainController
Controller for the main appointment view, handling the display and manipulation of appointments, filtering views, and navigating to appointment-related actions.
Constants
Contains application-wide constants for easy access.
Contact
Represents a contact's information, encapsulating contact ID, name, and email.
ContactsQuery
Provides static methods for querying the contacts table in the database.
CountriesQuery
Handles database queries related to the countries table.
Country
Represents a country record from the 'countries' database table.
Customer
Represents a customer in the system.
CustomerController
Controller for the customer management view.
CustomersQuery
Provides functionality for performing CRUD operations on the customers table in the database.
FirstLevelDivision
Represents a first-level division, such as a state or province, as defined in the 'first_level_divisions' database table.
FirstLevelDivisionsQuery
Provides functionality for querying the first_level_divisions table in the database.
FormHelper
Contains utility methods for manipulating and retrieving data from form elements within the application.
JDBC
Handles the database connection by utilizing JDBC (Java Database Connectivity).
LoginController
Controls the login view, handling user authentication and localization of UI elements.
ModifyAppointmentController
Controller for the Modify Appointment view, enabling users to update existing appointments.
ModifyCustomerController
Controller for the Modify Customer view, allowing users to update details of an existing customer.
SceneSwitcher
Provides static utility methods for switching between scenes in a JavaFX application.
TimeZoneConversion
Utility class for handling time zone conversions across different parts of the application.
User
Represents a user of the application, corresponding to a record in the 'users' database table.
UsersQuery
Handles database queries related to the users table.
